_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Dow Corning Corp. (www.dowcorning.com) is a member of the American Chemistry Council.  As such, the company uses the Responsible Care? management system to voluntarily improve its environmental, health, and safety performance.
Dow Corning?s Midland, Michigan manufacturing facility has implemented a Risk Management Plan.  The facility maintains communication with the community through its Community Advisory Panel and other activities.

Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

Dow Corning uses policies and procedures to manage environmental, health, and safety performance.  The company has established a Code of Business Conduct to guide its employees.  In addition, the Midland facility has implemented safety and environmental management systems.

Facility overview and regulated substances:

The Midland, Michigan facility (http://www.dowcorning.com/midland) manufactures a variety of specialty chemicals and silicone products. The following RMP-regulated chemicals are used: 
Ammonia
Ammonia (aqueous)
Dichlorosilane
Dimethyldichlorosilane
Ethyl Chloride
Ethyl Ether
Ethylene
Ethylenediamine
Hydrogen Chloride
Hydrochloric Acid (conc 37% or greater)
i-Butylene
i-Propylchloride
Methyl Chloride
Methyltrichlorosilane
Oleum
Propylene
Trichlorosilane
Trimethylchlorosilane
 
Accident prevention program:

The facility uses a systematic approach to prevent accidental releases through employee and contractor programs that include training, preventive maintenance, policies, procedures, safety reviews, change management procedures, investigations and audits.   

In addition, the facility has implemented chemical-specific accident prevention measures, including:
- Use of nitrogen to inert storage tanks
- Use of high-performance, corrosion-resistant materials
- Continuous air monitoring at select locations
- Automated emergency shutdown systems
- Emergency hydrogen chloride scrubbers

Five-year accident history:

The facility reports the followin

g accidents in the previous five years.  Accidents are investigated and followed up.  In February 2005, two operators received chemical exposures of trichlorosilane during a maintenance operation.  As a precaution, twenty people within a nearby business were asked to shelter in place.  In October 2006, two maintenance employees received chemical exposures of trichlorosilane that occurred during the replacement of a valve.

Emergency response program :

The Midland Facility uses the Incident Command System for emergency planning and response activities.  Emergency response plans are coordinated with the Midland County Emergency Response Plan and various Midland County Emergency Response Agencies, including the Midland City Fire Department. The facility conducts periodic drills to train site and community emergency response personnel, and participates in community-wide drills.  The facility funds a toll-free emergency phone line to provide important information during any community emergency.

Planned changes to improve safety:

The Dow Corning Midland, Michigan facility strives to continuously improve its environment, health, and safety performance through management system and equipment reliability improvements.  The facility uses a formalized project-oriented approach to improve performance.
